description: Construction of part two storey, part three storey warehouse and showroom (sui genuis) comprising 3,157sqm of floorspace (following the demolition of the existing two storey showroom) including the provision of on-site servicing, cycle parking, 9 no. car parking spaces and associated landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) P099, P100, P101, P102, P103, P200, P201, P202 and Stone World Construction Management Statement dated 30-03/2015.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces as shown on the approved plans of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | Details of cycle parking enclosure shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Cycle parking should be provided in a secure and lockable compound. The type of stand proposed must allow both wheels and the frame of the bicycle to be locked.   REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site in accordance policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 6.9 of The London Plan 2015. | Notwithstanding the approved plans, at least two of the car parking spaces shall provide electric vehicle charging points prior to the first occupation of the development.   REASON: To encourage the uptake of electric vehicles, in accordance with Ealing local  variation to London Plan policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.2 (k) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2015. | Details of a Delivery and Servicing Plan (DSP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The details shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter.   REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policiess 6.3 and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015). | The delivery vehicles entering the site shall be restricted to 16 tonnes.   REASON: To safegaurd highway users and to ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 1.1 (f)of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015). | Full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, details of boundary treatment, planting and surface finish shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the first operation of the use in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (i) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies 5.10 and 5.11 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 2.18 and 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | All external lighting for the development shall comply with ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011; CIBSE/SLL - FF7 Environmental Considerations for Exterior Lighting and CIBSE/SLL - LG6 Lighting Guide - Outdoor Lighting.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policy 7.6 of the adopted London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding the Energy Statement prepared by Maven Sustainability in 31st March 2015, prior to the commencement of the development, a report, which includes full details and drawings of the energy and sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve an overall minimum reduction in regulated carbon dioxide emissions by 35% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. Within 3 months of occupation of the warehouse and showroom, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.  REASON:  To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Statement and Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment and to ensure that the energy efficiency measures to be incorporated into the approved development contribute to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 (with REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | The approved development shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard (based on BREEAM 2014 Technical Guidance). Within three months of the commencement of the development, the following should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval: a) Evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM 2014 New Construction Scheme b) Interim BREEAM 2014 NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE for the relevant part of the development.   Within 3 months from the date of first occupation, a BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' and related Certification verified by the BRE for the relevant part of the development shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented:  Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the relevant part of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Refuse storage shall be provided on site in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.   Reason:  To protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2015) policy 5.16. | Notwithstanding the Phase II Ground Investigation Report, ref: 14333/GIR submitted in support of the application, prior to the commencement of any works on site (other than demolition and site clearance), a site investigation shall test the previously inaccessible ground, and the conceptual model shall be amended to include this. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. 	  REASON: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | A detailed remediation scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation. The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development, other than that required to carry out remediation works.   REASON: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced, and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.  REASON: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | No development shall commence until a detailed method statement for removing or the long-term management / control of Japanese Knotweed on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The method statement shall include measures that will be used to prevent the spread of Japanese Knotweed during any operations e.g. demolition, moving, strimming or soil movement. It shall also include measures to ensure that any soils brought to the site are free of seeds / root / stem of any invasive plant listed under the Wildlife and countryside Act 1981 (as amended). Development shall proceed in accordance with the approved method statement.  REASON: To protect and enhance the ecological value of the river corridor in accordance with policies 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | The development hereby permitted shall not be commenced until such a time as a scheme to provide Environment Agency staff access to the River Brent through the site has been submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall be fully implemented and subsequently maintained, in accordance with the timing / phasing arrangements embodied within the scheme or within any period as may subsequently be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: To protect the site from flooding by ensuring that the Environment Agency are able to inspect the flood defences behind the site in accordance with policy 1.2 (m) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), and policy 5.12 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Notwithstanding the Flood Risk Assessment submitted, an emergency access plan should be submitted to the Council for approval in consultation with the Environment Agency prior to the commencement of the development to demonstrate that a safe access and egress route in the event of flooding can be achieved. This shall demonstrate that the "safe" route would not be one where the predicted depth and velocity is unsuitable for such a route in the event of an emergency. The plan should also demonstrate that, in the event of a flooding incident, the emergency services would be able to undertake safe evacuation (e.g. if the fluvial flooding occurred without little warning). The emergency access plan should demonstrate compliance with the information within the Environment Agency's FD2320 technical guidance document.  REASON: To ensure that safe access and egress from the site can be achieved during a flood in accordance with policy 1.2 (m) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), and policy 5.12 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Vibration from demolition, breaking of concrete and piling etc., as measured in the vertical direction on any floor in surrounding noise sensitive buildings, shall not exceed an overall peak particle velocity level of 1mm/s.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policy 7.15 of the adopted London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Within 3 months of occupation of the development, a travel plan designed to manage the transport needs of staff and visitors, to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented once approved and shall be permanently retained in operation for the life of the development.  Reason: To limit the impact of the proposal on the highway network in accordance with policies, 6.3 6.11 and 6.12 the London Plan 2015.
